content.description:
This is a less-than-vertical slab just right of

Jim's Arete

. Beware that some of the juggy blocks at the top seem like they could pull out at some point.
content.location:
This ascends the Northwest corner of the boulder, just right of

Jim's Arete

.

content.description: Start on a downward pointing horn around 6', and climb the arete.
content.location:
This is on the Northwest corner of the boulder. It's the arete just opposite

Jim's Arete

.

content.description: Start matched on a low, big, chalked edge, and climb up the slightly overhanging arete using crimps and sidepulls.
content.location: This is the northwest arete - the one closest to the Grotto Wall lot and CO Highway 82.

content.description:
Get off the ground from Husky, and traverse left to a series of undercling pinches and an exciting time pulling the mini-roof. Finish on

Laser Chicken

.
content.protection: 2 pads. This has a flat landing, but it is pretty tall.
content.location: I chose to work from the Grotto Wall area parking (World of Hurt Boulder area) and walk up the hill to the giant, diamond-shaped boulder. You will pass 2 big boulders and see the next biggest boulder about another 50 yards up. Be careful of cars, since you are right around a corner! Walking down the talus wasn't so bad if you make the walk up the road to this larger boulder. There are sandy trails and mellow approach opposed to straight talus. You can also approach by crossing the guardrail, but it is a little longer walk (but definitely much safer choice).

content.description: Husky takes on the obvious, steep bulge on the west face. Start low on edges and climb out the bulge using underclings and sidepulls. Reach up right and slot a digit or tip in the finger-slicer slot (tape anyone?), take the pain, gather your courage, and set up for the throw to the victory jug of glory.
content.location: This ascends the obvious bulge on the west face / Grotto Wall parking lot side of the boulder.

content.description: Start on a big undercling flake, and move up the obvious dihedral/crack with a cool finger lock at 2/3 height.
content.location: This ascends the obvious dihedral on the west face / Grotto Wall parking lot side of the boulder.

content.description:
Start on

Husky Traverse

, and traverse right through a series of ledges, underclings, and sidepulls.
